info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 16 at 2:23PM PDT until August 16 at 4:30PM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 430 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR SAN BERNARDINO AND SOUTHERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 223 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the York Fire Burn Area. Between 0.25 and 0.75 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include the York Fire Burn Area. Although thunderstorms have moved out of the area, hazardous runoff is still possible and additional thunderstorms may develop this afternoon. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes is likely. The heavy rains will likely trigger rockslides, mudslides and debris flows in steep terrain, especially in and around these areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
